23namespace webrtc {
24namespace {
25
26constexpr float kDefaultTransparentModeGain = 0.01f;
27
28float GetTransparentModeGain() {
29 return kDefaultTransparentModeGain;
30}
31
32float GetEarlyReflectionsDefaultModeGain(
33 const EchoCanceller3Config::EpStrength& config) {
34 if (field_trial::IsEnabled("WebRTC-Aec3UseLowEarlyReflectionsDefaultGain")) {
35 return 0.1f;
36 }
37 return config.default_gain;
38}
39
40float GetLateReflectionsDefaultModeGain(
41 const EchoCanceller3Config::EpStrength& config) {
42 if (field_trial::IsEnabled("WebRTC-Aec3UseLowLateReflectionsDefaultGain")) {
43 return 0.1f;
44 }
45 return config.default_gain;
46}
47
48bool UseErleOnsetCompensationInDominantNearend(
49 const EchoCanceller3Config::EpStrength& config) {
50 return config.erle_onset_compensation_in_dominant_nearend ||
51 field_trial::IsEnabled(
52 "WebRTC-Aec3UseErleOnsetCompensationInDominantNearend");
53}
54
55// Computes the indexes that will be used for computing spectral power over
56// the blocks surrounding the delay.
57void GetRenderIndexesToAnalyze(
58 const SpectrumBuffer& spectrum_buffer,
59 const EchoCanceller3Config::EchoModel& echo_model,
60 int filter_delay_blocks,
61 int* idx_start,
62 int* idx_stop) {
63 RTC_DCHECK(idx_start);
64 RTC_DCHECK(idx_stop);
65 size_t window_start;
66 size_t window_end;
67 window_start =
68 std::max(0, filter_delay_blocks -
69 static_cast<int>(echo_model.render_pre_window_size));
70 window_end = filter_delay_blocks +
71 static_cast<int>(echo_model.render_post_window_size);
72 *idx_start = spectrum_buffer.OffsetIndex(spectrum_buffer.read, window_start);
73 *idx_stop = spectrum_buffer.OffsetIndex(spectrum_buffer.read, window_end + 1);
74}
75
76// Estimates the residual echo power based on the echo return loss enhancement
77// (ERLE) and the linear power estimate.
78void LinearEstimate(
79 rtc::ArrayView<const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> S2_linear,
80 rtc::ArrayView<const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> erle,
81 rtc::ArrayView<std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> R2) {
82 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(S2_linear.size(), erle.size());
83 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(S2_linear.size(), R2.size());
84
85 const size_t num_capture_channels = R2.size();
86 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_capture_channels; ++ch) {
87 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
88 RTC_DCHECK_LT(0.f, erle[ch][k]);
89 R2[ch][k] = S2_linear[ch][k] / erle[ch][k];
90 }
91 }
92}
93
94// Estimates the residual echo power based on the estimate of the echo path
95// gain.
96void NonLinearEstimate(
97 float echo_path_gain,
98 const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>& X2,
99 rtc::ArrayView<std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> R2) {
100 const size_t num_capture_channels = R2.size();
101 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_capture_channels; ++ch) {
102 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
103 R2[ch][k] = X2[k] * echo_path_gain;
104 }
105 }
106}
107
108// Applies a soft noise gate to the echo generating power.
109void ApplyNoiseGate(const EchoCanceller3Config::EchoModel& config,
110 rtc::ArrayView<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> X2) {
111 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
112 if (config.noise_gate_power > X2[k]) {
113 X2[k] = std::max(0.f, X2[k] - config.noise_gate_slope *
114 (config.noise_gate_power - X2[k]));
115 }
116 }
117}
118
119// Estimates the echo generating signal power as gated maximal power over a
120// time window.
121void EchoGeneratingPower(size_t num_render_channels,
122 const SpectrumBuffer& spectrum_buffer,
123 const EchoCanceller3Config::EchoModel& echo_model,
124 int filter_delay_blocks,
125 rtc::ArrayView<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> X2) {
126 int idx_stop;
127 int idx_start;
128 GetRenderIndexesToAnalyze(spectrum_buffer, echo_model, filter_delay_blocks,
129 &idx_start, &idx_stop);
130
131 std::fill(X2.begin(), X2.end(), 0.f);
132 if (num_render_channels == 1) {
133 for (int k = idx_start; k != idx_stop; k = spectrum_buffer.IncIndex(k)) {
134 for (size_t j = 0; j < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++j) {
135 X2[j] = std::max(X2[j], spectrum_buffer.buffer[k][/*channel=*/0][j]);
136 }
137 }
138 } else {
139 for (int k = idx_start; k != idx_stop; k = spectrum_buffer.IncIndex(k)) {
140 std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> render_power;
141 render_power.fill(0.f);
142 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_render_channels; ++ch) {
143 const auto& channel_power = spectrum_buffer.buffer[k][ch];
144 for (size_t j = 0; j < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++j) {
145 render_power[j] += channel_power[j];
146 }
147 }
148 for (size_t j = 0; j < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++j) {
149 X2[j] = std::max(X2[j], render_power[j]);
150 }
151 }
152 }
153}
154
155} // namespace
156
157ResidualEchoEstimator::ResidualEchoEstimator(const EchoCanceller3Config& config,
158 size_t num_render_channels)
159 : config_(config),
160 num_render_channels_(num_render_channels),
161 early_reflections_transparent_mode_gain_(GetTransparentModeGain()),
162 late_reflections_transparent_mode_gain_(GetTransparentModeGain()),
163 early_reflections_general_gain_(
164 GetEarlyReflectionsDefaultModeGain(config_.ep_strength)),
165 late_reflections_general_gain_(
166 GetLateReflectionsDefaultModeGain(config_.ep_strength)),
167 erle_onset_compensation_in_dominant_nearend_(
168 UseErleOnsetCompensationInDominantNearend(config_.ep_strength)) {
169 Reset();
170}
171
172ResidualEchoEstimator::~ResidualEchoEstimator() = default;
173
174void ResidualEchoEstimator::Estimate(
175 const AecState& aec_state,
176 const RenderBuffer& render_buffer,
177 rtc::ArrayView<const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> S2_linear,
178 rtc::ArrayView<const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> Y2,
179 bool dominant_nearend,
180 rtc::ArrayView<std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> R2) {
181 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(R2.size(), Y2.size());
182 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(R2.size(), S2_linear.size());
183
184 const size_t num_capture_channels = R2.size();
185
186 // Estimate the power of the stationary noise in the render signal.
187 UpdateRenderNoisePower(render_buffer);
188
189 // Estimate the residual echo power.
190 if (aec_state.UsableLinearEstimate()) {
191 // When there is saturated echo, assume the same spectral content as is
192 // present in the microphone signal.
193 if (aec_state.SaturatedEcho()) {
194 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_capture_channels; ++ch) {
195 std::copy(Y2[ch].begin(), Y2[ch].end(), R2[ch].begin());
196 }
197 } else {
198 const bool onset_compensated =
199 erle_onset_compensation_in_dominant_nearend_ || !dominant_nearend;
200 LinearEstimate(S2_linear, aec_state.Erle(onset_compensated), R2);
201 }
202
203 AddReverb(ReverbType::kLinear, aec_state, render_buffer, R2);
204 } else {
205 const float echo_path_gain =
206 GetEchoPathGain(aec_state, /*gain_for_early_reflections=*/true);
207
208 // When there is saturated echo, assume the same spectral content as is
209 // present in the microphone signal.
210 if (aec_state.SaturatedEcho()) {
211 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_capture_channels; ++ch) {
212 std::copy(Y2[ch].begin(), Y2[ch].end(), R2[ch].begin());
213 }
214 } else {
215 // Estimate the echo generating signal power.
216 std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> X2;
217 EchoGeneratingPower(num_render_channels_,
218 render_buffer.GetSpectrumBuffer(), config_.echo_model,
219 aec_state.MinDirectPathFilterDelay(), X2);
220 if (!aec_state.UseStationarityProperties()) {
221 ApplyNoiseGate(config_.echo_model, X2);
222 }
223
224 // Subtract the stationary noise power to avoid stationary noise causing
225 // excessive echo suppression.
226 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
227 X2[k] -= config_.echo_model.stationary_gate_slope * X2_noise_floor_[k];
228 X2[k] = std::max(0.f, X2[k]);
229 }
230
231 NonLinearEstimate(echo_path_gain, X2, R2);
232 }
233
234 if (config_.echo_model.model_reverb_in_nonlinear_mode &&
235 !aec_state.TransparentModeActive()) {
236 AddReverb(ReverbType::kNonLinear, aec_state, render_buffer, R2);
237 }
238 }
239
240 if (aec_state.UseStationarityProperties()) {
241 // Scale the echo according to echo audibility.
242 std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> residual_scaling;
243 aec_state.GetResidualEchoScaling(residual_scaling);
244 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_capture_channels; ++ch) {
245 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
246 R2[ch][k] *= residual_scaling[k];
247 }
248 }
249 }
250}
251
252void ResidualEchoEstimator::Reset() {
253 echo_reverb_.Reset();
254 X2_noise_floor_counter_.fill(config_.echo_model.noise_floor_hold);
255 X2_noise_floor_.fill(config_.echo_model.min_noise_floor_power);
256}
257
258void ResidualEchoEstimator::UpdateRenderNoisePower(
259 const RenderBuffer& render_buffer) {
260 std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> render_power_data;
261 rtc::ArrayView<const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> X2 =
262 render_buffer.Spectrum(0);
263 rtc::ArrayView<const float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> render_power =
264 X2[/*channel=*/0];
265 if (num_render_channels_ > 1) {
266 render_power_data.fill(0.f);
267 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_render_channels_; ++ch) {
268 const auto& channel_power = X2[ch];
269 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
270 render_power_data[k] += channel_power[k];
271 }
272 }
273 render_power = render_power_data;
274 }
275
276 // Estimate the stationary noise power in a minimum statistics manner.
277 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
278 // Decrease rapidly.
279 if (render_power[k] < X2_noise_floor_[k]) {
280 X2_noise_floor_[k] = render_power[k];
281 X2_noise_floor_counter_[k] = 0;
282 } else {
283 // Increase in a delayed, leaky manner.
284 if (X2_noise_floor_counter_[k] >=
285 static_cast<int>(config_.echo_model.noise_floor_hold)) {
286 X2_noise_floor_[k] = std::max(X2_noise_floor_[k] * 1.1f,
287 config_.echo_model.min_noise_floor_power);
288 } else {
289 ++X2_noise_floor_counter_[k];
290 }
291 }
292 }
293}
294
295// Adds the estimated power of the reverb to the residual echo power.
296void ResidualEchoEstimator::AddReverb(
297 ReverbType reverb_type,
298 const AecState& aec_state,
299 const RenderBuffer& render_buffer,
300 rtc::ArrayView<std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> R2) {
301 const size_t num_capture_channels = R2.size();
302
303 // Choose reverb partition based on what type of echo power model is used.
304 const size_t first_reverb_partition =
305 reverb_type == ReverbType::kLinear
306 ? aec_state.FilterLengthBlocks() + 1
307 : aec_state.MinDirectPathFilterDelay() + 1;
308
309 // Compute render power for the reverb.
310 std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> render_power_data;
311 rtc::ArrayView<const std::array<float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1>> X2 =
312 render_buffer.Spectrum(first_reverb_partition);
313 rtc::ArrayView<const float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> render_power =
314 X2[/*channel=*/0];
315 if (num_render_channels_ > 1) {
316 render_power_data.fill(0.f);
317 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_render_channels_; ++ch) {
318 const auto& channel_power = X2[ch];
319 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
320 render_power_data[k] += channel_power[k];
321 }
322 }
323 render_power = render_power_data;
324 }
325
326 // Update the reverb estimate.
327 if (reverb_type == ReverbType::kLinear) {
328 echo_reverb_.UpdateReverb(render_power,
329 aec_state.GetReverbFrequencyResponse(),
330 aec_state.ReverbDecay());
331 } else {
332 const float echo_path_gain =
333 GetEchoPathGain(aec_state, /*gain_for_early_reflections=*/false);
334 echo_reverb_.UpdateReverbNoFreqShaping(render_power, echo_path_gain,
335 aec_state.ReverbDecay());
336 }
337
338 // Add the reverb power.
339 rtc::ArrayView<const float, kFftLengthBy2Plus1> reverb_power =
340 echo_reverb_.reverb();
341 for (size_t ch = 0; ch < num_capture_channels; ++ch) {
342 for (size_t k = 0; k < kFftLengthBy2Plus1; ++k) {
343 R2[ch][k] += reverb_power[k];
344 }
345 }
346}
347
348// Chooses the echo path gain to use.
349float ResidualEchoEstimator::GetEchoPathGain(
350 const AecState& aec_state,
351 bool gain_for_early_reflections) const {
352 float gain_amplitude;
353 if (aec_state.TransparentModeActive()) {
354 gain_amplitude = gain_for_early_reflections
355 ? early_reflections_transparent_mode_gain_
356 : late_reflections_transparent_mode_gain_;
357 } else {
358 gain_amplitude = gain_for_early_reflections
359 ? early_reflections_general_gain_
360 : late_reflections_general_gain_;
361 }
362 return gain_amplitude * gain_amplitude;
363}
